name: Rim Shot
description:
Introduction

Park at the Moab Rim Trailhead on Kane Creek Road. Walk down Kane Creek Rd past Moonflower and to the Mastadon trailhead. After finding the Mastadon pictographs, hike up Mastadon canyon. At the top of Mastadon head left/north and across the Moonflower drainage. Continue up the slickrock to the Juniper sitting at the entry rappel, a 40 foot rappel. The 2nd rappel is also anchored off a Juniper and is 70 feet. The long rappel is the 3rd one and is bolted. Note: a 200 foot rope will not reach. The long rappel is the highlight of the route and is 210 feet. It is mostly free-hanging and is spectacular. The lower half has 3 rappels. 65 feet off bolts, 95 feet off a boulder, and 80 feet off bolts. At the bottom go down canyon 5 minutes to the road, then go right 5 minutes to the parking lot.

Approach

Descent

Exit

Red tape

Beta sites

http://www.climb-utah.com/Moab/rimshot.htm

Note: the beta on climb-utah is for the lower half only, 3 rappels, longest 95 feet.

Trip reports and media

Background
